 4.1 - COMPATIBLE
PARSING(LEVEL A)
On accessible websites...

In content implemented using markup languages, elements have complete start and
end tags, elements are nested according to their specifications, elements do not
contain duplicate attributes, and any IDs are unique, except where the
specifications allow these features. 

These websites...

Maximize compatibility with current and future user agents, including assistive
technologies.

WHAT'S AN EXAMPLE?
My bot couldn't find any ðŸ˜¢. But the linked pages might still have ones it
missed.

I still don't really understand
[https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/parsing.html#examples]

Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.2, W3C World Wide Web Consortium
Recommendation 27 February 2020 (https://www.w3.org/TR/2020/WD-WCAG22-20200227/,
Latest version at https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/)
